notes.title: Operative Note
notes.text: Procedure: Posterior spinal fusion T4-L1 for AIS. Estimated blood loss 450 mL. Neuromonitoring stable throughout. No dural tear. Wound closed in layers; sterile dressing applied. Post-op plan: standard pathway, multimodal analgesia, early mobilization. No immediate complications noted.

notes.title: Progress Note (POD2)
notes.text: POD2: Pain controlled overnight. Afebrile. Ambulating with PT. Dressing clean/dry/intact. No drainage. Plan: continue pathway, advance diet, bowel regimen.

notes.title: Discharge Summary
notes.text: Discharge diagnosis: AIS s/p posterior spinal fusion. Condition stable. Meds: acetaminophen, ibuprofen, oxycodone PRN, stool softener. Wound care: keep dressing for 48h then dry dressing PRN. Follow-up: Ortho clinic in 2 weeks. Return precautions: fever, worsening pain, redness, drainage.

notes.title: Telephone Encounter
notes.text: Mom reports increasing back pain over last 2 days and temps up to 100.4 at home. No vomiting. Unsure if incision looks different; dressing changed yesterday. Advised continue meds as prescribed and monitor temperature. Offered clinic visit; family prefers to watch today. Reviewed general return precautions.

notes.title: ED Provider Note
notes.text: 14F s/p PSF T4-L1 on 11/18 presents with fever 102.1 and worsening midline back pain. Family notes new drainage today. Exam: incision with mild erythema; small area of serous drainage. Vitals: febrile, tachycardic. Labs drawn; blood cultures pending. Ortho consulted. Concern for surgical site infection vs viral illness.

notes.title: Orthopedics Consult Note
notes.text: Seen in ED. Family reports drainage started 2-3 days ago, increased today. Incision: small inferior separation with drainage; tenderness present. Plan: admit for IV antibiotics after cultures, obtain imaging if worsens, consider OR washout if clinical course suggests deep infection.

notes.title: History & Physical
notes.text: Admitted for fever and suspected SSI after scoliosis fusion. Fever began today per parent. Pain escalated over last week. Drainage described as new today, but history inconsistent. Plan: empiric antibiotics, monitor vitals, trend CRP/ESR, coordinate with Ortho for possible intervention.

notes.title: Infectious Disease Consult
notes.text: Concern for post-op spinal surgical site infection. Recommend targeted antibiotic strategy once cultures result. Emphasize documentation of wound appearance and drainage volume; consider imaging for deep collection. Discussed with Ortho team.
